New Records: Virat Kohli broke the record for the most ODI centuries with his 50th century in the final.
Travis Head scored 137 runs, the highest by an Australian in a World Cup final since 2003.
Key Match Events: Travis Head and Marnus Labuschagne formed a 192-run partnership, turning the game in Australia's favor.
India's 240-run target was chasing, but Australia successfully achieved it with 241-4 in 43 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: Captain Pat Cummins elected to field after winning the toss, considering the pitch conditions.
The pitch was slow, and India's batters struggled to convert starts into substantial scores.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma expressed frustration but praised the team's effort, stating they 'tried everything we could'.
Virat Kohli was named Player of the Tournament for his exceptional performance, though it was overshadowed by the final loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Narendra Modi Stadium was packed with 105,000 fans, showcasing India's passionate support.
Australia's sixth World Cup win was celebrated with a trophy lift and emotional reactions from players.
Others: The match was live-streamed on Al Jazeera, providing extensive coverage and updates.
A detailed scorecard and live updates were available for followers to track the match.
